website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy power rack that's tough enough for the gym but compact enough for the home.
pros: Very quick and easy to get set up
Solid build and easy to use
Supports accessories and is a great size for power lifting in small spaces
cons: No way to level the rack, so you'll need to be sure the ground underneath it is level

customer_reviews.title: Much more sturdy then I expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent for the price. My main problems are that there is really no way to level it, so make absolutely certain your floor is sufficiently level. Despite that, I have had 300lbs (136kg) loaded on the bar catches with no warping, I have yet to drop the weight on the safety bars but they seem fairly strong and have supported at least 250lbs (113.4kgs) resting stationary on them. The chin up bar is nice and sturdy and supported me at 240lbs (108.9kgs) without having to be anchored to the ground, although I do have to bend my knees in order to fully lower myself at 6ft (1.83m).
customer_reviews.author: Spencer C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Power Rack for Your Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the money, easy to put together, and does everything the more expensive models claim to do. I even bought a set of dip bars (Valor Fitness MB-A BD-7 Dip Handle Accessory Set) and they fit perfectly. I couldn't ask for a better power rack for my home gym - highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rush

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the great reviews for this rack; I decided to give it a try. I do not regret my purchase. This was on my porch in just a couple days and it was perfectly packaged. I think this is the first piece of gym equipment that made it to my house without a single scratch or dent during shipping. Putting this rack together was super simple. The instructions and how the bolts are arranged make putting this together a breeze. I will recommend this rack to anyone looking for a basic rack for their home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: A great budget rack
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great buy for the price. It's been sturdy and is exactly the size I hoped it would be. I don't think it meets Mark Rippetoe's requirements for closeness of peg holes, but that's the sort of feature you can't expect in a $249 rack. The fact that delivery was included was extremely helpful to me because I don't have a car and therefore couldn't easily buy one from a store or warehouse. This is my first rack, so I can't speak with too much confidence or compare it to other options.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great rack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Rack is very solid and perfect for garage workouts. Very easy to assemble, i put the whole thing together by myself in less than an hour. Would be easier and safer with 2 people but possible to do it alone. Rack was packaged very well and each piece is individually wrapped and padded accordingly. There are 3 or 4 spots where the paint is bubbling off so im sure it'll begin rusting before too long but really and truly its a rack for a garage, a little rust wont hurt. All in all great purchase and look forward to using the rack for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Davjohn28

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to put together and super solid. No issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT product
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was very well done. None of the surfaces were damaged. They were well packed & protected. All parts were included. Nothing was missing. I thought the instructions were very clear. I am a senior citizen & was able to assemble this by myself. The rack is seems very stable. 2 adults weighing nearly 200 lbs have used the rack with no apparent wobble instability. This is very recommended as far as I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Howie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality in welds and paint.  Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a high quality rack. I have worked in metal fabrication and this is well made with good welds, and a good paint job. The paint appears to be epoxy enamel. It is a hard, thick finish but it can be scratched by the knurling on your bar. The instructions for assembly were well done and easy to follow. Plastic pads on the bottom protect your wooden floor from scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Seek Wisdom

customer_reviews.title: What’s a headline
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together good for small space could use a couple of more bars I don’t think would be good for real heavy stuff like over 250 pounds but it’s good for my uses I like it so far ... The security pins at the ends of the bars could be easier to use ... not good for a power lifter or heavy squatter but good for a home gym for most average guys I think
customer_reviews.author: william Gosman

customer_reviews.title: don't hesitate
customer_reviews.text: I was really unsure how this rack would be given the price. After using it for a year and a half now I must say I'm shocked how solid it has been. If your a professional or competitor maybe I could see spending the money on rogue but if you're like me this is all you need. I've loaded 315 for squats and it's solid. Chin ups (unweighted) no problem...it's steady front to back and side to side. No wobble. If your squat is over 500 or 600 you already squat on an expensive commercial rack. If not, don't hesitate to buy this rack.
customer_reviews.author: william vanscyoc

customer_reviews.title: Is it the best? No
customer_reviews.text: Is it the best? No.... but for the money, it's a heck of a good rack. You could add some J-hooks, but the stock hooks are okay for my needs. The rack is very sturdy and I'm able to safely do numerous kinds of lifts in it. Squats, presses, shrugs, etc.... all in a secure cage. I do wish there was a factory anchor system to mount the rack to the floor, but for the money I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny5

customer_reviews.title: ... cost and ease of putting it all together im happy with it
customer_reviews.text: A bit narrow inside the rack but for the cost and ease of putting it all together im happy with it. still has plenty of room to do squats or whatever other exercise.
customer_reviews.author: bruce

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this rack for several months now and it's working out great. Only grip would be the slick small surface for the pull up bar, but that's more opinion and can be remedied. I recommend this rack.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: I wish this had longer stabilizer bars at the bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish this had longer stabilizer bars at the bottom so I can do flips on the top bar. Rear bar should be circular not square so you can do chin ups on both sides. Inner weight bar holder not practical.
customer_reviews.author: Domo

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy at face value but skeptical due to apparent lack of nuts and bolts...
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to set up my Best Fitness Power Rack upon getting home from work only to find out, after carefully laying out all the pieces, that there were a total of zero nuts, bolts, and washers to assemble said rack... Will be more than happy to update my review depending on how Best Fitness' customer service rectifies the situation.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Keels

customer_reviews.title: Solid power rack for home gym
customer_reviews.text: A solid power rack for my home gym. Great price for this rack. I'm real glad I got this.
customer_reviews.author: eaj

customer_reviews.title: Still holding up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rack in 2018 for my home gym. It has held up fantastic! While it's not super heavy commercial gym quality steel, it holds extremely well. I have 3/4 dead-lifted 400+ pounds off the support bars and they are still straight. It's very sturdy and never feels cheap. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, best rack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Great rack for home gym. The only dislike I have is the thin pull up bar. It kills my hands. Nothing some athletic tape can’t fix. I also wish the lat/row attachment was just as much as the rack
customer_reviews.author: Sean T. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great for an avid lifter.
customer_reviews.text: I think for the price it is a good rack. Well packaged and easy to put together... one thing: be careful not to overtighten on posts. I kinked one in a bit, but i think it’s fine. You’ll see what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to assemble. Does the job for lifts. Pretty sturdy. Pull up bar feels too skinny for me though. I can only do strict pull up on these. It is not sturdy enough to manage Kipping movements. Overall good value for the money spent and purpose. Another thing I like about this is it is customizable. I just bought a bar dip accessory for this power rack.
customer_reviews.author: jigs

customer_reviews.title: Solid rack for the home gym
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish are very good and overall the rack is solid. If you are working with 400+ pound lifts you will want something beefier but for most folks this will work great.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to assemble. Never bought one before, but I love this one. Perfect for me. I’m a female 165 lbs, 5’9.
customer_reviews.author: MiMi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my son - very easy to put together and hold all of his weights
customer_reviews.author: Tanya M.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Awesome power rack for the price. The locking nuts/bolts were annoying but with two people you can knock it out.
customer_reviews.author: Darb

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for my home gym
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy rack. Very happy with it for a small home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Easy to set up, affordable, sturdy. Couldn't ask for more
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Rack
customer_reviews.text: Good Rack, I wouldn’t get crazy with it. Maybe no more than 300lbs. Works great up to that. I added some pipe to hold weights.
customer_reviews.author: Camilubers

customer_reviews.title: Best value in a rack
customer_reviews.text: My rack arrived in great shape and went together smoothly. I’m glad a listened to the guy that said to tighten all the bolts after they were all in. I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: craig m. page

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Easy to Assemble, and pretty good quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is pretty impossible to beat. Perfect home gym rack, and honestly its about as good as most of what I've seen at the gym. I'd have been happy if the gym just had a few more of these...
customer_reviews.author: stina

customer_reviews.title: Works great, pretty easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for about a week with a variety of barbell exercises, no complaints so far. Works great, pretty easy to assemble, easy to use, feels sturdy. Especially for the cost, I would definitely recommend this for the intermediate + lifter.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Gouty

customer_reviews.title: No hardware
customer_reviews.text: It was missing the hardware and other components. I'm not the only one it has happened to. I gave one star because I can't use it if I can't assemble it. I have to wait for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great for home gym with young athletes - not for heavy weight lifters.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gooch

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Requires sone clever thinking to install upper bars if alone, just have a friend help. Very sturdy, loving it 2 months in.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Schermer

customer_reviews.title: Solid power rack
customer_reviews.text: Good solid power rack. Exaxtly what we hoped it would be. Assembly was straight forward and quick with two people. Easy to use and not too big of a footprint in oir garage
customer_reviews.author: Heather B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Power Rack!
customer_reviews.text: Rack arrived in perfect condition and easy to assemble. Important tip: Make sure not to tighten bolts until rack is fully assembled as explained in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Eric La Flair

customer_reviews.title: great power rack
customer_reviews.text: It is safety conscious and has enough durability to take what I have to throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Fortin

customer_reviews.title: Quality product but delivery was missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, good price and sturdy. However, didn’t include the 2 lift off pieces.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, only issue is the paint isn't super tough, putting the safety bars in will scrap some off
customer_reviews.author: K3v

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Just as described and great price! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt D Hussey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I do not need a spotter great for single workouts
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very Sturdy and well put together. Comes in pieces and they give you everything you need to put it together including the little wrench, but you might want to fully tighten the parts your self once it's up. But works great
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: 2 years later
customer_reviews.text: It's less than a month away from 2 years that I've had this rack and it's still going strong after lots of use by myself and my 4 sons. It's sturdy and was easy to put together. I've added additional accessories to it that were 2" square 1" compatible and they've all fit. J-Hooks, weight plate holders, etc. I highly recommend this as the base for your weight training as it's affordable, well built, and fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: TK-420

product_meta.title: Body-Solid Best Fitness BFPR100 Adjustable Power Rack for Weightlifting and Strength Training
product_meta.description: The Best Fitness Power Rack (BFPR100) is an ideal combination of quality and value that lets you enjoy the same expansive weightlifting experience at home as in the gym. This weight cage is designed to help weightlifters fire up their workout safely and effectively, with two adjustable lift-offs and full-length safety bars for solo lifting. The 14-gauge 2-by 2-inch steel mainframe offers a robust 500-pound weight capacity, letting you use the machine for a variety of free weight and bodyweight lifting exercises. Use this workout cage for squats, incline presses, flat bench, shoulder shrugs, and more. Choose from 23 adjustment levels spaced 3 inches apart and customize your power rack with other Best Fitness components, such as the Lat Attachment (BFLA100), Dip Rack Attachment (DR100), and Folding Adjustable Bench (BFFID10). All barbells, weights, and collars are optional and sold separately. When assembled, the Best Fitness Power Rack measures 45 by 47 by 83 inches (L x W x H) and weighs 117 pounds. It is backed by the Best Fitness Three-Year In-Home , which covers the frame for three years and all other parts for one year.

SAFETY: The Body-Solid Best Fitness Power Rack helps weightlifters with training safely and effectively at home. Includes 2 adjustable lift-offs and 2 full-length safety bars

DIMENSIONS: The Body-Solid Fitness Power Rack measures 45 x 47 x 83 inches
